intro: Licania cuyabenensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno licania, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist lowland forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
